org.hps.record.daqconfig2019

Class DAQConfig2019Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.util.Driver
      • org.hps.record.daqconfig2019.DAQConfig2019Driver

  • public class DAQConfig2019Driver
extends Driver
    Class DAQConfig2019Driver is responsible for accessing the 2019 DAQ configuration settings, and then passing them to the associated class ConfigurationManager2019 so that they can be accessed by other classes.

    The driver may accomplish this by two means. By default, it will check each event for an EvioDAQParser2019 object which contains all of the DAQ configuration information and pass this to the ConfigurationManager2019. It will continue to update the ConfigurationManager2019 during the run if new parser objects appear, and can thusly account for changing DAQ conditions.

    The driver may also be set to read a DAQ configuration from text files containing the DAQ configuration bank information. The text files are located in resources. To enable this mode, the parameter daqConfigurationAppliedintoReadout need to be set true, or the parameter readDataFiles need to be set to true. runNumber defines the run number of the configuration to be loaded.

    This driver must be included in the driver chain if any other drivers in the chain rely on ConfigurationManager2019, as it can not be initialized otherwise. Code is developed referring to org.hps.record.daqconfig.DAQConfigDriver by Kyle McCarty
    See Also:
    ConfigurationManager2019

    • Method Detail

      • startOfData

        public void startOfData()
        Verifies the parameter filepath for the data file repository and checks that appropriate data files exist for the requested run number if the driver is set to read from data files. Otherwise, this does nothing.
        Overrides:
        startOfData in class Driver

      • process

        public void process(EventHeader event)
        Checks an event for the DAQ configuration banks and passes them to the ConfigurationManager2019 if the driver is set to read from the EvIO data stream. Otherwise, this will parse the data files on the first event and then do nothing.
        Overrides:
        process in class Driver
        Parameters:
        event - - The current LCIO event.

      • getDataFileArrays

        private static final String[][] getDataFileArrays(InputStream[] dataFiles)
                                           throws IOException
        Converts DAQ configuration data files into an array of strings where each array entry represents a line in the configuration file. The first array index of the returned object corresponds to the file, and the second array index corresponds to the line.
        Parameters:
        dataFiles - - An array of File objects pointing to the data files that are to be converted. These are expected to be plain text files.
        Returns:
        Returns a two-dimensional array of String objects where the first array index corresponds to the object of the same index in the File array and the second array index corresponds to the lines in the file referenced by the File object.
        Throws:
        IOException - Occurs if there is an issue with accessing or reading the objects in the objects referred to by the files pointed to in the dataFiles array.

      • getDataFileArrays

        protected static final String[][] getDataFileArrays(BufferedReader[] reader)
                                             throws IOException
        Converts DAQ configuration data streams into an array of strings where each array entry represents a line in the configuration file. The first array index of the returned object corresponds to the stream, and the second array index corresponds to the line.
        Parameters:
        reader - - An array of BufferedReader objects containing DAQ trigger configuration crate data.
        Returns:
        Returns a two-dimensional array of String objects where the first array index corresponds to the object of the same index in the BufferedReader array and the second array index corresponds to the lines in the stream referenced by the BufferedReader object.
        Throws:
        IOException - Occurs if there is an issue with reading data stream.

      • getRunNumber

        protected final int getRunNumber()
        Gets the run number that the DAQConfigDriver is set to use. This will be -1 in the event that the driver reads from an EvIO file.
        Returns:
        Returns the run number as an int primitive. Will return -1 if the driver is set to read from an EvIO file.

      • setRunNumber

        public void setRunNumber(int run)
        Sets the run number of the DAQ configuration being processed. This is only used when reading from data files.
        Parameters:
        run - - The run number of the data files to be used.

      • setReadDataFiles

        public void setReadDataFiles(boolean state)
        Sets whether or not to read the DAQ configuration directly from the EvIO data stream or whether to read the configuration from data files.
        Parameters:
        state - - true indicates that the configuration should be read from data files, and false that it should be read from the EvIO stream.

      • setDaqConfigurationAppliedintoReadout

        public void setDaqConfigurationAppliedintoReadout(boolean state)
        Sets whether or not the DAQ configuration is applied into the readout system.
        Parameters:
        state - - true indicates that the DAQ configuration is applied into the readout system, and false that it is not applied into the readout system.

      • mapBetweenRunNumberDAQVersion

        private String mapBetweenRunNumberDAQVersion(int runNumber)
        According to run number, a specified DAQ version name is returned.
        Parameters:
        runNumber -
        Returns:
        name of a DAQ configuration version
